data.name: سُورَةُ الطُّورِ
data.englishBism: In the name of God, The Most Gracious, The Dispenser of Grace

ayahs.englishText: CONSIDER Mount Sinai!
ayahs.arabicText: وَالطُّورِ

ayahs.englishText: Consider [God’s] revelation, inscribed
ayahs.arabicText: وَكِتَابٍ مَسْطُورٍ

ayahs.englishText: on wide-open scrolls.
ayahs.arabicText: فِي رَقٍّ مَنْشُورٍ

ayahs.englishText: Consider the long-enduring house [of worship]!
ayahs.arabicText: وَالْبَيْتِ الْمَعْمُورِ

ayahs.englishText: Consider the vault [of heaven] raised high!
ayahs.arabicText: وَالسَّقْفِ الْمَرْفُوعِ

ayahs.englishText: Consider the surf-swollen sea!
ayahs.arabicText: وَالْبَحْرِ الْمَسْجُورِ

ayahs.englishText: VERILY, [O man,] the suffering decreed by thy Sustainer [for the sinners] will indeed come to pass:
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّ عَذَابَ رَبِّكَ لَوَاقِعٌ

ayahs.englishText: there is none who could avert it.
ayahs.arabicText: مَا لَهُ مِنْ دَافِعٍ

ayahs.englishText: [It will come to pass] on the Day when the skies will be convulsed in [a great] convulsion,
ayahs.arabicText: يَوْمَ تَمُورُ السَّمَاءُ مَوْرًا

ayahs.englishText: and the mountains will move with [an awesome] movement.
ayahs.arabicText: وَتَسِيرُ الْجِبَالُ سَيْرًا

ayahs.englishText: Woe, then, on that Day to all who give the lie to the truth –
ayahs.arabicText: فَوَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِلْمُكَذِّبِينَ

ayahs.englishText: all those who [throughout their lives] but idly played with things vain –
ayahs.arabicText: الَّذِينَ هُمْ فِي خَوْضٍ يَلْعَبُونَ

ayahs.englishText: on the Day when they shall be thrust into the fire with [an irresistible] thrust, [and will be told:]
ayahs.arabicText: يَوْمَ يُدَعُّونَ إِلَىٰ نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ دَعًّا

ayahs.englishText: “This is the fire which you were wont to call a lie!
ayahs.arabicText: هَٰذِهِ النَّارُ الَّتِي كُنْتُمْ بِهَا تُكَذِّبُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Was it, then, a delusion or is it that you failed to see [its truth]?
ayahs.arabicText: أَفَسِحْرٌ هَٰذَا أَمْ أَنْتُمْ لَا تُبْصِرُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Endure it [now]! But [whether you] bear yourselves with patience or without patience, it will be the same to you: you are but being requited for what you were wont to do.”
ayahs.arabicText: اصْلَوْهَا فَاصْبِرُوا أَوْ لَا تَصْبِرُوا سَوَاءٌ عَلَيْكُمْ ۖ إِنَّمَا تُجْزَوْنَ مَا كُنْتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ

ayahs.englishText: [But,] verily, the God-conscious will find themselves [on that Day] in gardens and in bliss,
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّ الْمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّاتٍ وَنَعِيمٍ

ayahs.englishText: rejoicing in all that their Sustainer will have granted them: for their Sustainer will have warded off from them all suffering through the blazing fire.
ayahs.arabicText: فَاكِهِينَ بِمَا آتَاهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ وَوَقَاهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ عَذَابَ الْجَحِيمِ

ayahs.englishText: [And they will be told:] “Eat and drink with good cheer as an outcome of what you were wont to do,
ayahs.arabicText: كُلُوا وَاشْرَبُوا هَنِيئًا بِمَا كُنْتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ

ayahs.englishText: reclining on couches [of happiness] ranged in rows!” And [in that paradise] We shall mate them with companions pure, most beautiful of eye.
ayahs.arabicText: مُتَّكِئِينَ عَلَىٰ سُرُرٍ مَصْفُوفَةٍ ۖ وَزَوَّجْنَاهُمْ بِحُورٍ عِينٍ

ayahs.englishText: And as for those who have attained to faith and whose offspring will have followed them in faith, We shall unite them with their offspring; and We shall not let aught of their deeds go to waste: [but] every human being will be held in pledge for whatever he has earned.
ayahs.arabicText: وَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَاتَّبَعَتْهُمْ ذُرِّيَّتُهُمْ بِإِيمَانٍ أَلْحَقْنَا بِهِمْ ذُرِّيَّتَهُمْ وَمَا أَلَتْنَاهُمْ مِنْ عَمَلِهِمْ مِنْ شَيْءٍ ۚ كُلُّ امْرِئٍ بِمَا كَسَبَ رَهِينٌ

ayahs.englishText: And We shall bestow on them fruit and meat in abundance - whatever they may desire:
ayahs.arabicText: وَأَمْدَدْنَاهُمْ بِفَاكِهَةٍ وَلَحْمٍ مِمَّا يَشْتَهُونَ

ayahs.englishText: and in that [paradise] they shall pass on to one another a cup which will not give rise to empty talk, and neither incite to sin.
ayahs.arabicText: يَتَنَازَعُونَ فِيهَا كَأْسًا لَا لَغْوٌ فِيهَا وَلَا تَأْثِيمٌ

ayahs.englishText: And they will be waited upon by [immortal] youths, [as if they were children] of their own, [as pure] as if they were pearls hidden in their shells.
ayahs.arabicText: ۞ وَيَطُوفُ عَلَيْهِمْ غِلْمَانٌ لَهُمْ كَأَنَّهُمْ لُؤْلُؤٌ مَكْنُونٌ

ayahs.englishText: And they [who are thus blest] will turn to one another, asking each other [about their past lives].
ayahs.arabicText: وَأَقْبَلَ بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ يَتَسَاءَلُونَ

ayahs.englishText: They will say: “Behold, aforetime - when we were [still living] in the midst of our kith and kin - we were full of fear [at the thought of God’s dis­pleasure]:
ayahs.arabicText: قَالُوا إِنَّا كُنَّا قَبْلُ فِي أَهْلِنَا مُشْفِقِينَ

ayahs.englishText: and so God has graced us with His favour, and has warded off from us all suffering through the scorching winds [of frustration].
ayahs.arabicText: فَمَنَّ اللَّهُ عَلَيْنَا وَوَقَانَا عَذَابَ السَّمُومِ

ayahs.englishText: Verily, we did invoke Him [alone] ere this: [and now He has shown us] that He alone is truly benign, a true dispenser of grace!”
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّا كُنَّا مِنْ قَبْلُ نَدْعُوهُ ۖ إِنَّهُ هُوَ الْبَرُّ الرَّحِيمُ

ayahs.englishText: EXHORT, then, [O Prophet, all men:] for, by thy Sustainer’s grace, thou art neither a soothsayer nor a madman.
ayahs.arabicText: فَذَكِّرْ فَمَا أَنْتَ بِنِعْمَتِ رَبِّكَ بِكَاهِنٍ وَلَا مَجْنُونٍ

ayahs.englishText: Or do they say, “[He is but] a poet - let us wait what time will do unto him”?
ayahs.arabicText: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ شَاعِرٌ نَتَرَبَّصُ بِهِ رَيْبَ الْمَنُونِ

ayahs.englishText: Say thou: “Wait, [then,] hopefully; behold, I, too, shall hopefully wait with you!”
ayahs.arabicText: قُلْ تَرَبَّصُوا فَإِنِّي مَعَكُمْ مِنَ الْمُتَرَبِّصِينَ

ayahs.englishText: Is it their minds that bid them [to take] this [attitude] - or are they [simply] people filled with overweening arrogance?
ayahs.arabicText: أَمْ تَأْمُرُهُمْ أَحْلَامُهُمْ بِهَٰذَا ۚ أَمْ هُمْ قَوْمٌ طَاغُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Or do they say, “He himself has composed this [message]”? Nay, but they are not willing to believe!
ayahs.arabicText: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ تَقَوَّلَهُ ۚ بَلْ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ

ayahs.englishText: But then, [if they deem it the work of a mere mortal,] let them produce another discourse like it - if what they say be true!
ayahs.arabicText: فَلْيَأْتُوا بِحَدِيثٍ مِثْلِهِ إِنْ كَانُوا صَادِقِينَ

ayahs.englishText: [Or do they deny the existence of God?] Have they themselves been created without anything [that might have caused their creation]? or were they, perchance, their own creators?
ayahs.arabicText: أَمْ خُلِقُوا مِنْ غَيْرِ شَيْءٍ أَمْ هُمُ الْخَالِقُونَ

ayahs.englishText: [And] have they created the heavens and the earth? Nay, but they have no certainty of anything!
ayahs.arabicText: أَمْ خَلَقُوا السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ ۚ بَلْ لَا يُوقِنُونَ

ayahs.englishText: [How could they?] Are thy Sustainer’s treasures with them? Or are they in charge [of destiny]?
ayahs.arabicText: أَمْ عِنْدَهُمْ خَزَائِنُ رَبِّكَ أَمْ هُمُ الْمُصَيْطِرُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Or have they a ladder by which they could [ascend to ultimate truths and] listen [to what is beyond the reach of human perception]? Let, then, any of them who have listened [to it] produce a manifest proof [of his knowledge]!
ayahs.arabicText: أَمْ لَهُمْ سُلَّمٌ يَسْتَمِعُونَ فِيهِ ۖ فَلْيَأْتِ مُسْتَمِعُهُمْ بِسُلْطَانٍ مُبِينٍ

ayahs.englishText: Or, [if you believe in God, how can you believe that] He has [chosen to have] daughters, whereas you yourselves would have [only] sons?
ayahs.arabicText: أَمْ لَهُ الْبَنَاتُ وَلَكُمُ الْبَنُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Or is it that [they who reject thy message, O Muhammad, fear lest] thou ask of them a reward, so that they would be burdened with debt [if they should listen to thee]?
ayahs.arabicText: أَمْ تَسْأَلُهُمْ أَجْرًا فَهُمْ مِنْ مَغْرَمٍ مُثْقَلُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Or [do they think] that the hidden reality [of all that exists] is almost within their grasp, so that [in time] they can write it down?
ayahs.arabicText: أَمْ عِنْدَهُمُ الْغَيْبُ فَهُمْ يَكْتُبُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Or do they want to entrap [thee in contradic­tions]? But they who are bent on denying the truth - it is they who are truly entrapped!
ayahs.arabicText: أَمْ يُرِيدُونَ كَيْدًا ۖ فَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا هُمُ الْمَكِيدُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Have they, then, any deity other than God? Utterly remote is God, in His limitless glory, from anything to which men may ascribe a share in His divinity!
ayahs.arabicText: أَمْ لَهُمْ إِلَٰهٌ غَيْرُ اللَّهِ ۚ سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ

ayahs.englishText: AND YET, if they [who refuse to see the truth] were to see part of the sky falling down, they would [only] say, “[It is but] a mass of clouds!”
ayahs.arabicText: وَإِنْ يَرَوْا كِسْفًا مِنَ السَّمَاءِ سَاقِطًا يَقُولُوا سَحَابٌ مَرْكُومٌ

ayahs.englishText: Hence, leave them alone until they face that [Judgment] Day of theirs, when they will be stricken with terror:
ayahs.arabicText: فَذَرْهُمْ حَتَّىٰ يُلَاقُوا يَوْمَهُمُ الَّذِي فِيهِ يُصْعَقُونَ

ayahs.englishText: the Day when none of their scheming will be of the least avail to them, and they will receive no succour.
ayahs.arabicText: يَوْمَ لَا يُغْنِي عَنْهُمْ كَيْدُهُمْ شَيْئًا وَلَا هُمْ يُنْصَرُونَ

ayahs.englishText: But, verily, for those who are bent on doing evil, there is suffering in store [even] closer at hand than that [supreme suffering in the hereafter]: but most of them are not aware of it.
ayahs.arabicText: وَإِنَّ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا عَذَابًا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَ وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ

ayahs.englishText: And so, await in patience thy Sustainer’s judgment, for thou art well within Our sight. And extol thy Sustainer’s limitless glory and praise whenever thou risest up,
ayahs.arabicText: وَاصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ فَإِنَّكَ بِأَعْيُنِنَا ۖ وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ حِينَ تَقُومُ

ayahs.englishText: and extol His glory at night, and at the time when the stars retreat.
ayahs.arabicText: وَمِنَ اللَّيْلِ فَسَبِّحْهُ وَإِدْبَارَ النُّجُومِ
